meta.title: Clarkston Community Schools - Clarkston, MI

header.h2: Learn Here. Grow Here. Thrive Everywhere.

p.span: We are an award-winning public school district in Clarkston, Michigan.

div.p: You'll find everything you need on our individual school websites and our Student and Parent Pages. New to Clarkston? Get started below!

img.alt: An SPE Teacher holding a cup that says "Teachers Rule"

div.class: fsElement fsNews fsSlideshow fsItemCount_9 fsSlideshowHorizontal fsThumbnailOriginal fsThumbnailLarge

img.alt: From Superintendent Ryan: Student Social Media Incident

div.a: From Superintendent Ryan: Student Social Media Incident

div.p: Late last night we were made aware of an offensive racial video that was posted by a Clarkston Junior High School student on TikTok and subsequently shared across other social media platforms. The behavior and language observed in this video were hurtful, deplorable, and not representative of our district's respect for all people.

article.a: Read more about From Superintendent Ryan: Student Social Media Incident

img.alt: From Superintendent Ryan: Virtual At-Home Learning Grading Options

div.a: From Superintendent Ryan: Virtual At-Home Learning Grading Options

div.p: Feedback from staff, students, and families strongly supports the need to implement a compassionate, fair, and consistent grading policy for our students in Grades 6-12 as they engage in virtual learning opportunities.

article.a: Read more about From Superintendent Ryan: Virtual At-Home Learning Grading Options

img.alt: CCS Board President Offers Virtual High Fives

div.a: CCS Board President Offers Virtual High Fives

div.p: Our School Board President Kelli Horst offered "virtual high fives" to Clarkston staff, students, and families on behalf of the CCS Board of Education after the first week of virtual at-home learning. You won't want to miss her touching shout-out to the Class of 2020.

article.a: Read more about CCS Board President Offers Virtual High Fives

img.alt: From Superintendent Ryan: First Week of Virtual Learning

div.a: From Superintendent Ryan: First Week of Virtual Learning

div.p: I hope you're hanging in there. I realize that between your work responsibilities and now your responsibilities as a "homeschool parent," you may be a bit stressed. Though none of us has ever experienced circumstances like these, the Clarkston Community Schools family of students, parents, and educators have quickly risen to the occasion, as usual.

article.a: Read more about From Superintendent Ryan: First Week of Virtual Learning

img.alt: Ready for Clarkston Virtual At-Home Learning?

div.a: Ready for Clarkston Virtual At-Home Learning?

div.p: Virtual At-Home Learning begins tomorrow, Monday, April 6. We are so proud of the effort and collaboration of our teachers and district curriculum team, and are confident that the lessons we have developed will keep students engaged and moving forward without overwhelming families.

article.a: Read more about Ready for Clarkston Virtual At-Home Learning?

img.alt: From Superintendent Ryan: School Closure Update

div.a: From Superintendent Ryan: School Closure Update

div.p: As we are all processing Governor Whitmer's latest Executive Order to close school buildings for the remainder of the school year, I know most of you are wondering what this means for your family. In my own home, the conversations have revolved heavily around what's presumed to be lost: classroom interactions, connections with friends, end-of-year rites of passage.

article.a: Read more about From Superintendent Ryan: School Closure Update

img.alt: All Schools Closed for Remainder of 2019-2020 School Year

div.a: All Schools Closed for Remainder of 2019-2020 School Year

div.p: Governor Gretchen Whitmer signed today Executive Order 2020-35, which will close school facilities in Michigan for the remainder of this school year as a result of the COVID-19 coronavirus pandemic.

article.a: Read more about All Schools Closed for Remainder of 2019-2020 School Year

img.alt: From Superintendent Ryan: Virtual At-Home Learning Begins April 6

div.a: From Superintendent Ryan: Virtual At-Home Learning Begins April 6

div.p: As we reach the end of our second week away from school, I'd like to share some key updates with you, including our plans for transitioning to Clarkston Virtual At-Home Learning on Monday, April 6.

article.a: Read more about From Superintendent Ryan: Virtual At-Home Learning Begins April 6

img.alt: Board of Education Closed Session March 26

div.a: Board of Education Closed Session March 26

div.p: The CCS Board of Education has scheduled a Closed Session meeting for the purpose of discussing negotiations. The meeting will begin in open session at 4pm on Thursday, March 26, through a virtual Google Meeting.

article.a: Read more about Board of Education Closed Session March 26

div.a: Last Half Day of School (All Students)

a.title: Powered by Finalsite opens in a new window

div.p: Based upon Governor Gretchen Whitmer's executive order on April 2, Clarkston Community Schools will be closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. Teaching and learning continues with Clarkston Virtual At-Home Learning.

No student in Clarkston will go hungry during the school closure. Families can pick up free "Grab & Go" meals at three of our school locations as well as four community drop-off points on Tuesdays and Fridays.
Please see www.clarkston.k12.mi.us/covid-19 for more updates and information about the district's response to the COVID-19 outbreak.
